block.p: Re ''Errors and Poor Supervision Cited in Bonfire Collapse'' (news article, May 3), about the factors resulting in the Texas A&M University tragedy: The bonfire tower was apparently constructed without the input of an architect or a structural engineer. Certainly, no other structure on the campus could be built without the certification of professionals.

Re ''Errors and Poor Supervision Cited in Bonfire Collapse'' (news article, May 3), about the factors resulting in the Texas A&M University tragedy: The bonfire tower was apparently constructed without the input of an architect or a structural engineer. Certainly, no other structure on the campus could be built without the certification of professionals.

Also, one would think the planned bonfire would have received the attention of the federal or state environmental agency. We in New England cannot burn our autumn leaves because of the resulting air pollution; why can such a huge fire be ignited in Texas?
